bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Ford mss., 1892-1929 contains drawings by illustrator Henry Justice Ford (1860-1941). As a young man, Ford studied at Clare College, Cambridge and later the Slade School of Fine Art and Bushey School of Art. In the 1890s, he became known both for his exhibitions of historical paintings and landscapes and for his illustrations of famous fable and fairy tale collections. His most notable works include his drawings for The Arabian Nights Entertainments (1898) and the Andrew Lang Fairy Books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of seven matted pen-and-ink drawings and four pastel drawings for Andrew Lang's Fairy Books.
